visualization_prompt: Generate a spline chart showing synthetic quarterly revenue growth with dynamic updates using time-series data with trend and seasonal noise
visualization_explanation: The dataset contains two-dimensional time-series data with datetime x-values (quarterly intervals) and continuous y-values (revenue in millions). Synthetic data follows a positive trend (μ=0.2M/quarter) with seasonal noise (σ=0.15M), maintaining financial domain plausibility through constrained growth rates and temporal spacing. The spline chart maximizes data-ink ratio by eliminating redundant gridlines while preserving trend visibility through curved interpolation. Perceptual grouping is enhanced using a monochromatic scheme with varying marker sizes, adhering to Cairo's principles of visual hierarchy. Animated transitions and format-string annotations ('$6.3M') follow financial reporting conventions while maintaining accessibility through high-contrast elements.
